Palencia unveil ridiculous new ‘inside-out’ kit http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/13/pictures-spanish-side-c-d-palencia-unveil-ridiculous-new-inside-out-kit-5878915/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/13/pictures-spanish-side-c-d-palencia-unveil-ridiculous-new-inside-out-kit-5878915/#respond Fri, 13 May 2016 07:44:00 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878915 ]]>

Y ahora todo el equipo pic.twitter.com/GFuZH4iL6O

— C.D. Palencia (@CDPalencia) May 12, 2016

C.D. Palencia really haven’t held back with their new kit.

The Spanish third tier side unveiled what their players will be wearing next season on Thursday evening, and have certainly gone for a ‘daring’ design.

Perhaps in an effort to put off any squeamish opponents, the jersey and shorts feature the human anatomy that is supposedly underneath.

For an unknown reason, the makers, Kappa, lost their bottle with the socks and left them plain black.

Whether this outfit will help or hinder Palencia is unknown, but it will certainly grab the attention of anyone lining up against them in the coming campaign.

Diego Torres la estrena pic.twitter.com/NGzhOOhA3D

— C.D. Palencia (@CDPalencia) May 12, 2016

MORE: Euro 2016: Metro.co.uk writers reveal their England starting XI

Arsenal could try an ambitious transfer move for Napoli striker Gonzalo Higuain following the news of Danny Welbeck’s nine-month injury layoff.

The Gunners have a long list of targets to strengthen their attack this summer, with the likes of Olivier Giroud, Theo Walcott and even Alexis Sanchez proving disappointing this season.

With only 61 league goals, Arsenal have the statistically weakest attack in the top four this season, and would certainly do well to add the prolific Higuain to their ranks.

On Monday England manager Roy Hodgson will name the 23 players he will be taking to France’s Euro 2016 tournament this summer.

Hodgson, who has already delayed the announcement of his squad, was due to reveal his chosen players this Thursday but wants to wait on the fitness of his players until the Premier League season has finished.

(Picture: Who Scored) lineup-820 (3) Arsene Wenger given until October to decide on future after Arsenal offer Frenchman new two-year deal http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/13/arsene-wenger-given-until-october-to-decide-on-future-after-arsenal-offer-frenchman-new-two-year-deal-5878838/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/13/arsene-wenger-given-until-october-to-decide-on-future-after-arsenal-offer-frenchman-new-two-year-deal-5878838/#respond Fri, 13 May 2016 07:09:52 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878838 ]]>

Arsenal have set Arsene Wenger an October deadline to decide on his future after the Gunners reportedly offered the Frenchman a new two-year deal.

The 66-year-old is under more pressure than at any stage during his 20-year stay in north London after a disappointing season at the Emirates.

Many supporters have protested against Wenger and the club’s owners in recent weeks, with a large section of the fanbase dismayed with the club’s failure to challenge for the league title.

Wenger’s current deal runs out next summer and there are calls for him to step down in 2017 when his contract expires.

Chelsea have reportedly cancelled a farewell tribute to captain John Terry, which had been set to take place at their end-of-season awards.

This has led to rumours that the 35-year-old may end up staying with the Blues, despite his contract ending this summer.

The centre-back is yet to be offered as new deal, and the arrival of Antonio Conte as manager promises a shake up at Stamford… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/13/chelsea-cancel-john-terry-farewell-tribute-in-hint-he-could-stay-at-stamford-bridge-5878846/feed/ 0 Chelsea v Tottenham Hotspur - Premier League maxmiller72 LONDON, ENGLAND - MAY 02 : John Terry of Chelsea during the Barclays Premier League match between Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur at Stamford Bridge on May 2, 2016 in London, England. Chelsea have reportedly been told by former boss Carlo Ancelotti that they can sign Bayern Munich ace Mario Gotze for £35 million.

The Italian is taking over at the Allianz Arena when Pep Guardiola leaves this summer, and doesn’t see the Germany international in his plans.

Liverpool have also been linked with the 23-year-old, but The Sun have revealed that the Blues are already in talks with the player’s representatives.

Gotze has struggled to make an impact for Bayern this season, managing one goal and four assists in a paltry 13 Bundesliga appearances.

With the England squad for Euro 2016 set to be announced, there has been fresh debate about who should be on the plane to France.

As with every international tournament, there is a wide range of opinions on which players deserve their place, which players are living off their reputation, and talk of potential wildcards and youngsters ready to make surprise names for themselves.

Whatever happens, Roy Hodgson is sure to be in for criticism from some sides, but he won’t be the first to deal with an equally hostile press and fanbase.

Days before the end of the Premier League season, there already seems to be movement in the transfer market.

Latest gossip sees positive news coming from Liverpool, Arsenal, Manchester United and Manchester City.

And we’ve rounded it all up for you right here…

Mario Gotze making enquiries about Liverpool transfer – report

Bayern Munich star Mario Gotze has been making enquiries about joining Liverpool this summer.

The Germany international has been strongly linked as a top target for his old manager Jurgen Klopp in recent times.

Gotze looks likely to be out of the first-team picture at Bayern next season, and seems open to a switch to Anfield.

There’s encouraging news from Arsenal fans after last year’s shambles in the transfer market.

The Gunners only signed one player last summer, bringing in goalkeeper Petr Cech from Chelsea – a fine signing in itself, but not enough for Arsene Wenger’s side’s needs.

Still, it looks like work has already begun on improving the side this summer…

Arsenal want N’Golo Kante deal before Euro 2016 – report

Mesut Ozil is on the cusp of becoming Arsenal’s first ever player to earn £200,000-a-week, according to reports.

The German international currently has two years remaining on his £140,000 contract but has had doubts cast over his future following yet another disappointing season for Arsenal.

Given the pressure on Arsene Wenger, the Mirror’s John Cross has claimed that the French boss is confident Ozil will commit his future to the club by signing the new deal this summer.

Already the club’s top earner, the reported new deal would include a number of add-ons and bonuses which would see him become the first Arsenal player in history to break… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/mesut-ozil-close-to-signing-new-200000-arsenal-contract-5878748/feed/ 0 Chelsea v Arsenal - FA Community Shield leethomasmasonmetro Frank de Boer ‘interested in Everton job’, says his brother Ronald http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/frank-de-boer-interested-in-everton-job-says-his-brother-ronald-5878715/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/frank-de-boer-interested-in-everton-job-says-his-brother-ronald-5878715/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 22:04:02 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878715 ]]>

Former Ajax manager Frank de Boer is ‘interested in the Everton job’, according to his brother Ronald.

De Boer, who left Dutch side Ajax yesterday after failing to secure the Eredivisie title on the final day after a 1-1 draw with De Graafschap – a team sitting second bottom of the division

The last-day result meant that Ajax handed the title to PSV Eindhoven in the most dramatic of turn of events.

Liverpool midfielder Philippe Coutinho was named Liverpool’s Player of the Season for the second year in a row.

The little Brazilian scooped an astonishing FOUR awards at Liverpool’s end of season awards evening, a reward for yet another superb campaign in what has proved a turbulent one with the sacking of Brendan Rodgers.

As well as being name Player of the Season, Coutinho won Player’s Player, Goal of the Season and Performance of the Season for his display in Liverpool’s 4-1 win away at Manchester City.

The winning strike, his wonderful solo goal away at Old Trafford, sealed Liverpool’s Europa League win against their… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/phillipe-coutinho-cleans-up-four-awards-at-liverpools-end-of-season-review-5878681/feed/ 0 Lee Thomas-Mason Lee Thomas-Mason Lee Thomas-Mason Lee Thomas-Mason Lee Thomas-Mason Lee Thomas-Mason Lee Thomas-Mason Lee Thomas-Mason Liverpool leethomasmasonmetro The Liverpool award winners. (Picture: Getty) Why Arsenal should not try and sign Leicester City’s N’Golo Kante in the summer transfer window http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/why-arsenal-should-not-try-and-sign-leicester-citys-ngolo-kante-in-the-summer-transfer-window-5873759/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/why-arsenal-should-not-try-and-sign-leicester-citys-ngolo-kante-in-the-summer-transfer-window-5873759/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 21:30:48 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5873759 ]]>

Arsenal are being linked with a £20million bid for Leicester City midfielder N’Golo Kante.

Sir Alex Ferguson has described the tireless midfielder as one of the best players in the league this season – and he’s not wrong.

But, although it may seem ridiculous, I do not think the Gunners should try and sign the Frenchman this summer.

At £20m (his rumoured release clause) Kante represents brilliant value in an often-overpriced transfer market.

But is he the type of player Arsenal need?

Kante’s industrious work ethic would be welcome, but he doesn’t give the team the physical playmaker that we currently lack.

Kante is not… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/why-arsenal-should-not-try-and-sign-leicester-citys-ngolo-kante-in-the-summer-transfer-window-5873759/feed/ 0 Oli Price-Bates Leicester City v Everton - Premier League olipb Raphael Varane ready to join Manchester United if Jose Mourinho is appointed manager http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/raphael-varane-ready-to-join-manchester-united-if-jose-mourinho-is-appointed-manager-5876690/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/raphael-varane-ready-to-join-manchester-united-if-jose-mourinho-is-appointed-manager-5876690/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 20:36:30 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5876690 ]]>

Manchester United’s hopes of signing Raphael Varane this summer hinge on the club’s appointment of Jose Mourinho, according to reports.

The France international is recognised as one of the finest defenders in Europe but he’s failed to tie down a first-team spot at the Bernabeu with Sergio Ramos and Pepe in front of him.

The 23-year-old chose Madrid over Manchester in 2012 and cited the Red Devils’ signing of Phil Jones just weeks earlier as the main reason why he didn’t move to Old Trafford.

Manchester United midfielder Morgan Schneiderlin has not been included for France’s Euro 2016 squad by Didier Deschamps.

Only earlier this week we reported how the former Southampton man feared his lack of playing time this season could mean he misses out on a spot in France’s Euro 2016 squad – a self-doubt that has seemingly come to fruition.

Former Liverpool defender Jamie Carragher couldn’t resist a sly dig at Everton in the wake of Roberto Martinez’s sacking.

Martinez, who was relieved of his duties following the humiliating 3-0 defeat to Sunderland, has been under incessant pressure as his Everton side registered just one Premier League win in their last ten outings.

After failing to overcome Manchester United in the FA Cup semi-final, Martinez’s hopes of keeping his job at Goodison Park suffered a huge setback and Everton eventually confirmed the departure with just one Premier League game remaining.

Roberto Martinez has finally been sent packing by Everton, sacked after a dismally underwhelming campaign.

The Spaniard arrived on Merseyside in 2013 with a reputation for attempting flowing, attractive football, having guided Wigan to an unlikely FA Cup victory.

But despite Everton aiming for European football this season after signing Romelu Lukaku, Oumar Niasse and Ramiro Funes Mori on big money deals in recent years, the highest the Toffees can finish is 11th place.

Supporters have grown frustrated at the side’s defensive frailties, and the general inconsistency from the side – especially after enduring a 4 – 0 thrashing from arch rivals Liverpool in last month’s derby.

Here are the stats… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/the-horrifying-stats-that-prove-everton-had-to-sack-roberto-martinez-5878149/feed/ 0 Alex Taylor Alex Taylor 502593124 ataylor1790 Morpheus gerrad Could this bust-up pave the way for Neymar to seal Manchester United transfer? http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/could-this-bust-up-pave-the-way-for-neymar-to-seal-manchester-united-transfer-5878391/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/could-this-bust-up-pave-the-way-for-neymar-to-seal-manchester-united-transfer-5878391/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 16:52:56 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878391 ]]>

Manchester United could be clear to seal the transfer of Barcelona’s Neymar after a shock revelation about a bust-up involving the Brazilian.

Catalonia-based football journalist Javi Miguel revealed that Neymar was involved in a furious row with team-mate Javier Mascherano.

The war of words was due to the Brazilian attacker’s ‘selfish play’, Miguel told radio programme ‘El Club de la Mitjanit’.

Mascherano rounded on his team-mate in the wake of Barcelona’s Champions League quarter-final exit at the hands of Atletico Madrid.

‘Stop being so selfish,’ the Argentina international is alleged to have yelled at Neymar before adding: ‘Think more about the team’.

Arsenal are prepared to make an offer for Real Madrid ‘s James Rodriguez in the summer transfer window, according to reports in Spain.

Rodriguez moved to the Bernabeu for £63million back in 2014 after an incredible World Cup with Colombia but has struggled for game-time this season at Madrid.

AS say the 24-year-old could be tempted to move on at the end of the season and the Gunners are ready to make a bid to land the £120,000-a-week midfielder.

It’s understood Manchester United, Manchester City and Chelsea are also considering moves for Rodriguez this summer.

Arsene Wenger is looking to bring attacking reinforcements to… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/arsenal-ready-to-make-transfer-bid-for-james-rodriguez-5878354/feed/ 0 Tom Olver james tolver100 james Manchester United star Bastian Schweinsteiger looks ready for battle in Clash of Kings commercial http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/manchester-united-star-bastian-schweinsteiger-looks-ready-for-battle-in-clash-of-kings-commercial-5878339/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/manchester-united-star-bastian-schweinsteiger-looks-ready-for-battle-in-clash-of-kings-commercial-5878339/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 16:27:30 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878339 ]]>

Bastian Schweinsteiger may not have played for Manchester United for two months but he looks pretty ready for battle in this new commercial.

Promoting the mobile game ‘Clash of Kings’, the German World Cup winner has been filmed sporting a beard and king’s armour as he prepares to go into battle with a medieval army.

The commercial, shot in Manchester by DCMN, starts with Schweinsteiger walking his army into battle, only to be brought back to reality by the sound of a lawn mower.

He then finds himself in a football stadium, playing the game on his phone.

The 30-second commercial will screen… Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/manchester-united-star-bastian-schweinsteiger-looks-ready-for-battle-in-clash-of-kings-commercial-5878339/feed/ 0 George Bellshaw George Bellshaw George Bellshaw George Bellshaw schweinsteiger army originalfooty schweinsteiger army Clash of Kings_04 Clash of Kings_06 Clash of Kings_09 Clash of Kings_11 Everton postpone end of season awards after Roberto Martinez sacking http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/everton-postpone-end-of-season-awards-after-roberto-martinez-sacking-5878289/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/everton-postpone-end-of-season-awards-after-roberto-martinez-sacking-5878289/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 15:44:23 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5878289 ]]>

Everton have postponed their end of season awards due to Roberto Martinez being sacked.

The club released a statement explaining that it would be disrespectful to carry on with the ceremony in the circumstances.

The event, which was due to take place tonight, has now been pushed back until some time before the start of next season.

Everyone who had planned to attend the event will be notified with details once it has been rearranged.

Here’s the full statement from the club:

Tthe Club’s End of Season Awards, due to be held at St George’s Hall tonight, has been postponed. pic.twitter.com/W7OiRl0V6Q

— Everton (@Everton) Read the full story]]> http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/everton-postpone-end-of-season-awards-after-roberto-martinez-sacking-5878289/feed/ 0 Sunderland v Everton - Premier League originalfooty Stats show Manchester United transfer target Zlatan Ibrahimovic IS getting better with age http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/stats-show-manchester-united-transfer-target-zlatan-ibrahimovic-is-getting-better-with-age-5877897/ http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/12/stats-show-manchester-united-transfer-target-zlatan-ibrahimovic-is-getting-better-with-age-5877897/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 15:43:35 +0000 http://metro.co.uk/?p=5877897 ]]>

Like a fine wine, Zlatan Ibrahimovic is getting better with age – and the stats are there to prove it.

At 34, any regular footballer’s career is beginning to peter out but Zlatan, obviously, is no ordinary player…the guy is superhuman.

The Paris Saint-Germain and Sweden talisman will leave the Stade de France at the end of the season and a number of elite European clubs are still after him.

And considering Ibrahimovic has scored 36 goals in 30 Ligue 1 appearances this term, is this really a surprise?

Roberto Martinez’s three-year reign as Everton boss has today come to an end.

Toffees chairman Bill Kenwright gave the Spaniard his marching orders after a disappointing third season on Merseyside.

The former Wigan and Swansea boss replaced David Moyes in 2013 following a historic FA Cup win with the Latics, and the Blues finished 5th in his first season.

However, having spent big on the likes of Romelu Lukaku and Oumar Niasse over the last two years, a return of a finish no higher than 11th this season is not acceptable for the board.
